summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). It authenticates transcripts of Maxwell's depositions taken in 2016 and agrees they may be received as evidence at trial, subject to standard objections. The document is signed by the U.S. Attorney and Maxwell's defense attorneys.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The stipulation authenticating Maxwell's 2016 deposition transcripts was filed in court, dated November 2021.

keyFacts: The document is a court stipulation authenticating transcripts of Ghislaine Maxwell's depositions from April 22, 2016, and July 22, 2016.
The authenticated deposition transcripts are intended to be received as Government exhibits at Maxwell's criminal trial (S2 20 CR 330), subject to standard legal objections.
The stipulation is signed by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and consented to by Maxwell's four defense attorneys: Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The document indicates the ongoing pre-trial evidence authentication process in Maxwell's federal criminal case as of November 2021.
